meanings.definition: A feeling of great happiness or enjoyment.
meanings.sent1: The children had jollies at the birthday party with games and cake.
meanings.sent2: She always gets the jollies when she visits the amusement park.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics brought jollies to everyone watching.
meanings.sent4: The colorful fireworks in the night sky gave a burst of jollies to the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The jollies on their faces showed how much they enjoyed the music festival.

meanings.definition: To amuse oneself or have fun.
meanings.sent1: He jollies by playing with his favorite toy car.
meanings.sent2: They jollies by going on hikes in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The cat jollies with a ball of yarn, rolling around in delight.
meanings.sent4: She jollies in the sun, feeling the warmth on her face.
meanings.sent5: We jollies at the beach, building sandcastles and splashing in the waves.

meanings.definition: To tease or make fun of someone in a playful way.
meanings.sent1: The siblings jollies each other about their silly dance moves.
meanings.sent2: Friends often jollies each other about their favorite sports teams.
meanings.sent3: She would jollies him about his love for pineapple on pizza.
meanings.sent4: The classmates would jollies him good-naturedly about his funny hat.
meanings.sent5: They would always jollies each other, but it was all in good fun.
